intro: Caucaea nubigena, commonly known as the cloud forest caucaea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes numerous species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, often in shades of white and pale pink. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface, adapted to the moist, shaded environments it inhabits. Caucaea nubigena plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of cloud forest ecosystems.
